comments.body:
Could be a fun twist in the Deep Dark, as long as it spawns below other major features it should be doable. Or, even safer, are accessed by random doors/gateways that appear leading to a pocket dimension, which only last for 100 in-game days. This means anything left in one will vanish, if a player is in one when it expires has two consequences. For easy or normal they are booted back to the overworld where they entered. For Hard and Hardcore death in the void. I feel this kinda Event would fit perfectly with the magic and dimensions magic established by Mojang. I saw a mod that sorta touched on this but the player crafted the doorways. I like the idea a bit more as some dungeon event, but would love an end game personal pocket dimension I could craft access to for a traveling base. 

This could also be a fun way to limit Warden and Skulker sensor access if they are features in this pocket dimension that only periodically occur. Or some new mobs that give hints of changes, origins, of the desolate end. Perhaps the "End" is the space between dimensions, the End Dragon the force that keeps a society form traveling across the worlds again. and Endermen the monitors of the worlds.

Ich liebe die Idee, ich hoffe, das kommt zu Minecraft Das nächste, was wir haben, ist der Dschungeltempel, der nicht so rilly ist wie das, was Sie Sead haben und ärgerlich, wenn es unter oder in oder um oder über Ihrem Hinterteil ist, aber selbst wenn das passiert, kann es so selten wie so selten wie Osion-Denkmäler werden. (Es tut mir leid, dass ich an Rechtschreibung scheiße und ich nicht Deutsch spreche, also habe ich Google Translate verwendet, sorry, wenn es abgenutzt ist)
A maze dungeon would be epicly SICK
That is cool but how would it work mechanically
Thanks guys, for the votes!
ITS A GOOD IDEA LETS HOPE IT HAPPENS!!!
I'm down for any kind of ocean surface structures.

Yes! I've always wanted to see ships spawning in the ocean, and it's a great idea to have some as pillagers, but also others that are good like ordinary villagers.  Maybe, the good ships can have unique traders on them?  Maybe the pillager ships could have particularly interesting treasures or artefacts to loot.

There could be trader ships (imagine a bit bigger than a usual ship, with lots of cargo on, barrels, chests etc); villager ships which could be small and be like explorers with a single unusual trader on them; and the pillager ships full of nasty pirates and cool treasure.

I would love them to be hanging from the ceeling, something like normal mineshafts already have (they connect with chains to ceeling)

It would work well with my suggestion of netherite generated also near ceeling.
Hello, I'm new here, this idea looks cool, this would make a change in the deserts...
Love it
I agree
Give the dragon egg a use.
add a owl to this update

Looks like someone on the "Bosses of Mass Destruction" mod saw your request and did a bang-up job creating it... Mind blowing, I tell you.

Fabric (1.19.4) w/ Bosses of Mass Destruction (1.6 - Beta)
Seed: -1910750648048799864
Coords: -1536, ~, 66

I don't know if they should implement this idea specifically as mayan or aztec pyramids, however I like the idea of adding some similar structures or update the current desert pyramid or jungle temple to resemble the new archeology features.

Note: This would very likely be quite a rare structure. Definitely not as rare as a woodland mansion, but NOWHERE near as common as your average village. Maybe something like a 10% chance of spawning.

My son and I were just discussing the idea that graveyards should be an optional area on the outskirts of a village. That seems more natural to us than as a stand alone area.

We thought all of the following would be great additions to Minecraft:
     Add grave yards and add special features of that area.
     "Grave stones" (new one block high head stones) would mark several "special locations" called "graves" (new two block area) that could spawn skeletons. ( At a much lower rate than a spawner. Maybe one a night at midnight? ) And, the "grave" would need to have "buried bones" to spawn skeletons. Maybe the "Graveyard" could also have "unmarked graves" (lacking head stones) that would work the same way too.

      Maybe the "graves" could spawn other monsters too. Based on a buried head of the monster to be spawned. ( This way players could use the graveyard as a "custom spawner" for specific resources.)
       And maybe any mobs spawned in the graveyard during a "new moon" would have extra hearts or more powerful weapons. (And maybe better item drops too?) That would increase the likely hood of spawning "Dullahan" ( The lord of the graveyard ) too! [ We love the idea of "Dullahn"! ]

It could be fun to sit back and see who would wins a battle between an Iron Golem and Dullahn. ( It should only soften up "Dullahn" not kill. )

Bonus: Have Dullahan able to summon:  https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360048848291-NEW-Monster-Mob-Assailants-Groves-w-Graveyards
I think the canal should be infested with silverfish and drowned. It will be much harder to just dig around avoiding all challenges

Some clarifications:

I don’t know the precise shape of this dungeon but it’s rather linear (not too many side roads) so it would likely be a corridor or more likely a kind of spiral so that Mining Fatigue can come from the center of it.

Also, on top of this effect, the interior should be mostly made out of obsidian to resist TNT. It’s not possible for piston doors as pistons can’t move obsidian, but it would be the case for the walls with 1×1 holes, and of course all the external walls, floors and ceilings. The outside should look nicer, so a layer of another block should cover the obsidian.

Many chorus fruits should be found inside as loot, to make sure that the player can always leave. Also, maybe the right way to make it work is to add a special block, on which players teleport themselves if they eat a chorus fruit near enough. This block would be placed at the entry and the player will be able to take it after disabling the Mining Fatigue. If you like this idea, see here.

I didn’t tell anything about the monsters or treasures you would find inside this special dungeon because this post is only about the teleportation gameplay features of the dungeon. It should be compatible with other ideas about the End. I still have an idea of what the boss could look like but I made a separate post about it so that you can choose to vote for it or not.
i like this idea. it would make minecraft alot more fun! >o< :)
What if, instead of mining fatigue, whatever mob spawns there (if the is one) will attack you, making it nearly impossible to get through by breaking blocks.

ThomarWharr I think you would really need many, many hostiles mob to achieve that and it would kill the player. Except if you add a new mob that stops the player without harming him and which have so many life points that you can't get rid of it easily.

Speaking of mobs, I also think that endermen should regularly spawn inside to supply the player with ender pearls if he or she needs it.

There are two more things I would like to add to the original post. First, you can complicate the processes for opening doors, for example by putting a button and a door at both ends of a corridor with several turns, or adding the small windows I talked about between them, or jumping elements or high steps you would have to teleport yourself in. At the beginning of the dungeon, it would be simple, but at the end, there would be a real obstacle course!

Second, about the small windows: to prevent the player from using water or trapdoors to crawl in, they could be smaller than 1×1, using slabs or even stairs. As there are no obsidian slabs or stairs, the window can still be blown up with TNT but in a small room, the player would also take damage. And TNT costs more than ender pearls in the End…

also there could be a special three (sky peach?) in the sanctuary that can grant special wood that can be used in crafting hi efficency gears and buff granting fruits

obtain the sampling of the three will be a great goal, but again very dungerous cause is impossible to harvest the three without tools, and using tools will trigger the attack of the Gold Golem
Isn't this a sonic place? Hmmm
Maybe new boss: ice master, can give you new frozen status effect that stops you from moving/slows you down and damages.

(continued) Now, coal naturally replaces some parts of the bone blocks in the fossil. When the player is rebuilding the fossil, in order for it to spawn, they need to replace those coal blocks with bone blocks, either ones the player has crafted, or ones found naturally. *The entire structure/fossil needs to be made of Bone Blocks in order for it to spawn the Ancient Beast*.

When that is done, the Ancient Beast will spawn. (Or right click the completed fossil with a Totem of Undying?) The Ancient Beast is a massive mob resembling the fossil. There will be different varieties of Ancient Beast. and different skins, for each one.

As fossils are made of 8 total different set structures (4 skulls and 4 ribcages), there will have to be 16 varieties of Ancient Beast in the game, one for each fossil combination. There can be great creative liberties taken with their designs, and some can be based off of dinosaur-like creatures, or some can be based off of ice age mammals, it’s up to the developers to create these monsters.

However, they should keep the same AI for simplicity sake. They will all have a single rare item drop, along with some bone blocks.

This idea sounds amazing, it would add a ton to the game. I have a few suggestions and tweaks I might add to the idea though.
1) To make it easier on the developers, we could decrease the amount of possible configurations of the beast. Possibly even just one. As much as I love the idea of multiple different beasts, it’s a bit too much to ask for.
2) instead of cloning the boss, what if you just had to tap it with a totem of undying? When so has happened, there would be a gigantic explosion, which would clear out a “battlefield” underground.
3) Once the boss has been slain, it should drop a rare item that doesn’t necessarily have to be useful but could be. The best object I could come up with was a scale. The scale could be used as a shield which had infinite durability.
Any other ideas for a drop would be cool as well!
Nah. It eliminates the point of building and creating your own base. We need more creating in the game not just taking over things.
I loooooooooooooove that idea!!!!!!!!!!!!!
How would this work?
What are you trying to say?
I'd honestly just like to be able to use structure blocks to save structures that contain jigsaw blocks.

seria epico pero tambien tipos de raids imagina que lleguen barcos
The player would get infinite gunpowder so they could get TNT and fireworks for infinite flight. Can't vote for it man. Sorry.

Do players get infinite bonemeal from skeleton spawners? No.

Only as much as they're willing to grind at the spawner.

Bones, Bone Meal, Rotten Flesh, Strings, and all those other drops that players get from natural spawners aren't that really effective unlike Gunpowder. Gunpowder is very effective and that's why it's not that easy to get. I'm sorry but I still can't vote for it but you can vote your own post so that you get that -1 vote.
Sorry, I can't vote because creeper spawners would be way to OP for players.

I'm sorry but this would wreck server economy. Its a good thought, but the 1.16 made gold worthless (indirectly decreasing the value of gapples etc.), and we don't need TNT and fireworks to go the same way.
I don't understand what you guys are saying, creeper farms are easy to make and spawn creepers faster than a spawner could, I say it should be added cuz it adds another small challenge to the game.

These two:

- hopper on top of compost is putting things to the compost

- hopper below compost is taking bonemeal from the compost

are already in game since they added compost. It's fullautomation already.

As a reply to the previous comment, while hoppers can fully automate composers, there are good reasons to want to also be able to do it with a dispenser. 
Hoppers can get blocked if a non-compostable item gets in the system. If the dispenser where to “shoot” or drop a non-compostable item, the hopper below could catch the item and not clog up the system. This would be ideal for filtering items that might go into an overflow chest at complex industrial area.

How about putting the hopper by the side of compost? 

I hope that will be able to come to the same thing with the hopper on top.

If that so, it would let the iron farm item sorter be more simple:

A hopper below the hopper which is set by the side of compost could catch irons cause they are non-compostable.
I do not understand why this would be cool.

The variety is neat, and adding a new reason for the players to explore. Encountering one of these could also be its own challenge. Once you find one, you can either go around it, over it, under it, or along it. This would add structure generation never before seen in Minecraft... Basically these would actually be the most unique structures in the game, with so many possibilities of generation.

Pardon the meme, but...

We're going to build a wall... and make the mobs pay for it!

XD

But seriously, this sounds like a neat idea, especially if they have a similar appearance to Nether Fortresses: It could look like a certain ancient Asian civilization had been trying to protect itself from invading mobs or players.

As Charles Hillman said, encountering such a structure would present some neat challenges, especially if some of the walls contained hard-to-break blocks such as Obsidian, or annoying blocks like Gravel or Sand holding back a stream of Water or Lava! Heck, why not have an explosive trap? There are almost endless possibilities for generating these, and Minecraft needs more structures like that.
Think it would take some reworking on how it is generated, but cool sugestion.

What if all the shelves were replaced, and you had to search through for the purple-spined enchanted books, but there were also written books mixed in, 10 or so variants, that added lore? These could be notes taken by the ancient builders like the book the dwarves left in the Mines of Moria, or maybe poems and fables from different cultures, which adds to the recent theme of a multi-cultural Minecraft. These could be new collectors items similar to music discs, and could change with the display language. Maybe even to pirate speak.
deep dark portal looks good
All I have to say is OF COURSE!!!
I really support this idea so that the block reinforced deepslate is not only a decoration in the ancient city
Super cool but you should specify if they are hard to find.
Pls add in mcpe deep dark cities portal then i love it

I think that it should go to a world that is limited in size to the number of deep dark cities available to portal to. Each new discovered portal would enlarge the world size and the player would be mostly unable to break blocks in that world, with the exception of a few valuable otherwise unobtainable blocks and those that the player places in this world. 

Each new Ancient City Portal would add a bit more "city" to the ancient city portal world. THe world would be completely surrounded in all 3d by bedrock, and when new portals would be discovered a new block of structures would be added and the appropriate bedrock would be expanded to accommodate the new space. (so the player would be enclosed by visible bedrock, which would expand as new portals were generated). In this way the world size of the Ancient City Portal world would constantly expand, and with each new portal added, additional world-specific rare blocks would become available. 

 

There WOULD be mobs, although the world size would be so small until large numbers of portals were discovered that mobs would be unlikely or impossible until the world size expanded to a large number of portals discovered.
This does nothing to the game.
I personally love this idea! It would add really interesting aesthetics to the game.
It does have a big change so people would be careful not to slaughter villagers if they want trades.
